EmailTemplate.name: Noeline's Email Template
EmailTemplate.subject: Social Welfare and Pensions Bill 2014
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear Committee Members,
I am writing to you on behalf of FLAC and our fellow independent law centre, Northside Community Law Centre, based in Coolock in Dublin. We are sending you this joint submission of our concerns on the Social Welfare and Pensions Bill which we note has been debated at Second Stage yesterday, 5 June 2014 and is due to go to Committee on Wednesday next. This submission is going to all of the members of the Joint Oireachtas Committee. If there is someone else that you would like us to send it to, we can do that. If you have any questions about this, please do not hesitate to contact me or my colleagues as follows:
FLAC: Noeline Blackwell 086-8139089
FLAC: Yvonne O’Sullivan 01-8873626
NCLMC: Moya de Paor 01-8477804
NCLMC: Jane O’Sullivan 01-8477804
Kind regards
Noeline Noeline Blackwell
Director General
FLAC (Free Legal Advice Centres Ltd.)
13 Lower Dorset Street, Dublin 1, Ireland
Ph: (353) 1 887 3600
Lo-call: 1890 350 250
Fax: (353) 1 874 5320
Web: http://www.flac.ie
Free Legal Advice Centres Ltd is a company limited by guarantee not having a share capital, registered in Dublin, Ireland. Company registration number 49413. Directors: Joanne Hyde, Don Crewe, Liam Thornton, Peter Ward, Róisín Webb
NB: The information in this e-mail is intended for the listed addressee(s). It may be confidential and may be legally privileged. Access to this e-mail by anyone else is unauthorised. If you are not the intended recipient, any distribution, copying, or other actions taken in reliance on it are prohibited and may be unlawful. The opinions and advice contained in this e-mail may not be those of FLAC.
************************************
FLAC – promoting access to justice
